data.title: Fix crash saving a missing processor, added folder picker for output/int directories.
MonoGame.Core central PCL lib discussion
data.body:
Now with 3.2 behind us and the clean-up operation under-way, is now a good time to raise the discussion around the Core project again?

Main aim is to move all non-platform specific project in to a single central PCL project to be consumed by all platforms.

Benefits:
- Single library for core functions / classes / structs
- Guaranteed compatibility across all supported platforms (Linux / PSM being the only exceptions)
- Reduces the platform DLL's down to just those classes that are platform dependant

Over time though the use of the "helpers" more classes could be moved to the Core PCL over time.

This would enable the project to focus efforts to simplify the codebase.

Thoughts?

data.title: Ensure a playing song is stopped when switching songs.
data.body:
With multiple songs queued up in MediaPlayer and using the MediaPlayer.Default implementation, my existing Song wasn't being told to stop playing before the next one could start, resulting in a resource conflict or overlapping songs. It looks like in many cases the underlying platforms are enforcing a one-song-at-a-time setup. For those who don't, this should prevent conflicts.

@RayBatts Does this look sane?

data.title: Weird freeze compiling shader on Galaxy S3 Mini
data.body:
Hi!

I was getting lots of bad ratings from Galaxy S3 Mini, so I decided to get one to increase the numbers of devices I can test my android games to two :)

The problem appears when rendering one specific part of the game (the terrain) which uses just a BasicEffect. The game does not crash, but freezes. The stack is more or less, this:

GL.CompileShader (_shaderHandle)
vertexShader.GetShaderHandle (first time, before the first GL.AttachShader
ShaderProgramCache.Link
_programCache.GetProgramInfo
ActivateShaderProgram
PlatformApplyState
PlatformDrawPrimitives
GraphicsDevice.DrawPrimitives

there are no aparent errors related to this problem in the log. 

It's not a random issue, every time the program hits that section, it's a freeze. The game apparently works  well on most devices.

I'm using BasicEffect in other places before the crash. (isn't it weird that it has to be compiled more than one time?)

Any ideas?
Thanks!
Kak

EDIT: Wow, I just randomly found that the game does not crash, but it takes an insane amount of time (varies between 20 and 30 seconds) to execute GL.CompileShader. Game runs well afterwards.

data.title: Drawing shifted up and off screen in KitKat
data.body:
Here's some sample code to reproduce the issue: https://bitbucket.org/nykular_sinha/shiftedgraphics/src

I've reproduced it on the Nexus 5 (4.4.2), Galaxy S5 (4.4.2), and Galaxy S3 (4.4.3), all with a version of KitKat.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Run app on phone.
2) Disconnect USB debugging
3) Exit app
4) Run app again
5) Exit app
6) Run app
7) If bug does not appear, go back to step 5

I've never had to do step 5 more than 2 times to reproduce the error.

Here's what it should look like, and does on the initial run.

data.title: FreeImage TextureImporter Support
data.body:
This PR addresses https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2478.

On Windows platforms, we're now using the FreeImage library to import image files. This adds support for a LOT of different image file types, most notably .dds files. http://freeimage.sourceforge.net/features.html

FreeImage is multiplatform, but this PR only addresses Windows. I'll leave Linux and OSX for people that can properly build and test against it.

At the moment, the Texture Importer/Processors and a couple of other related classes (Such as fonts) are implemented System.Drawing.Bitmap. In order to quickly add this feature and preserve functionality, we're using FreeImage to import the image, then passing a System.Drawing.Bitmap through the system. Eventually the goal is to stop using the System.Drawing library and replace its functionality with that of FreeImage. There are several wins there.

We also noticed a problem in Texture.GetPitch(). The fix was accidentally committed and added to this pull request, though it's still valid.

data.title: Fix stencil clear
data.body: Some drivers (especially on Android) will obey the stencil test when clearing the stencil buffer (the specs says it shouldn't). This workaround ensure that the stencil buffer will properly be cleared.

data.title: Fixed pitch being doubled sometimes for mono sounds.
data.body:
This is a more reliable fix than https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1940.
`AudioFileStream.StreamBasicDescription` (aka `DataFormat`) sometimes returns invalid properties `BytesPerPacket`, `BytesPerFrame`, `ChannelsPerFrame`. They are negative or zero. Mono sound is treated as stereo and its pitch becomes doubled.

Related bug: [Failed to get buffer attributes error when playing sounds](https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=11074)
Related issue: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1123

`AVAudioPlayer` can be used to get these properties reliably except `AudioFileStream.DataByteCount`.

data.title: Make disabling SynchronizeWithVerticalRetrace work on WindowsGL
data.body:
So you can disable VSync and get lots of screen tearing if that is your thing.
This is now implemented properly like it is on other platforms.

I have a little test project for this here:
https://github.com/danzel/WrapTest/compare/disable-vsync
You can move `graphics.SynchronizeWithVerticalRetrace` around and check the behaviour.

This is how it works in XNA (And MonoGameDX), but worked differently in WindowsGL:

Set it in Game constructor - Setting is applied. (Didn't work in GL)
Set in Initialize (No ApplyChanges) - Nothing happens (This would previously set it in GL)
Set in Initialize and ApplyChanges - Setting is applied

Fixes #1862
